channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump plans to pardon former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez
item.description: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez was convicted for drug trafficking and weapons charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.
item.content:encoded:
Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez was convicted for drug trafficking and weapons charges and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

(Image credit: Elmer Martinez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Airbus calls for 'immediate' software upgrade to A320 aircraft
item.description: A320 planes are flown by a number of domestic and international airlines, and the required software update could lead to "operational disruptions to passengers and customers," according to Airbus.
item.content:encoded:
A320 planes are flown by a number of domestic and international airlines, and the required software update could lead to "operational disruptions to passengers and customers," according to Airbus.

(Image credit: Daniel Slim)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Trump administration pausing all asylum decisions after National Guard shooting
item.description: After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.
item.content:encoded:
After the alleged shooter was identified as Rahmanullah Lakanwal — a 29-year-old Afghan national — Trump said he would permanently shut down immigration from impoverished countries.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Zelenskyy's chief of staff resigns as Ukraine corruption investigations widen
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced the resignation of his powerful chief of staff, Andrii Yermak, whose residence was searched earlier in the day by anti-corruption investigators.

(Image credit: Martial Trezzini/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site
item.description: On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.
item.content:encoded:
On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.

(Image credit: Chris McGrath)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Death toll from floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra rises to 164
item.description: The death toll from flash floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra island Friday rose to 164 on Friday with 79 people missing, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
The death toll from flash floods and landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra island Friday rose to 164 on Friday with 79 people missing, authorities said.

(Image credit: Binsar Bakkara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israeli forces kill at least 10 in southern Syria raid, officials and residents say
item.description: Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.
item.content:encoded:
Syria's foreign ministry said in a statement Friday that the attack was "a horrific massacre" and said women and children were among those killed.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: National Guard member dies from injuries. And, death toll in Hong Kong fire rises
item.description: National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.
item.content:encoded:
National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom had died from her injuries after a shooting in the nation's capital. And, the death toll in the Hong Kong high-rise fire rises as dozens remain missing.

(Image credit: Andrew Leyden)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A bright spot for turtles: Olive ridleys are recovering in India, but still at risk
item.description: India's olive ridley turtle numbers appear to have rebounded after years of patchwork efforts to stem their decline. Can it last?
item.content:encoded:
India's olive ridley turtle numbers appear to have rebounded after years of patchwork efforts to stem their decline. Can it last?

(Image credit: Diaa Hadid)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: The DOT says it wants to make trucking safer, but some see an 'immigration raid'
item.description: The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown by another name.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say it's an immigration crackdown by another name.

(Image credit: Cody Jackson)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
